channel.title: Objects
channel.description: edit: how do i click on an object say a box then make it give you something like a coin then click on another box that takes your coin and gives u a phat. but if you dont have a coin the second box wont give u a phat.

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @jr_pwn jr pwn
item.description:
@jr_pwn wrote:

ty soo much that was a great tut. and thats not what im useing it for it was just an example but thanks![br][size=1]Posted on: October 05, 2007, 08:18:24 PM[/size][hr][quote=“blitz_9100, post:4, topic:149329”]here you go

if(objectID == ###) { //#### is the objectid
addItem(995,1);//995 is the coin and 1 is the amount
}

where do i put all that thought under client.java?

if(objectID == ####) {//#### is the objectid
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 1)) {//995 is the itemid and 1 is the amount
addItem(1041,1);//1041 is the coin and 1 is the amount
}
else {
sendMessage("you need a coin before you can get anything from this box");
}
}

there you go i think if i got my item id right its a blue phat

i put my defintions in there for you so you can understand it[/quote]
but where do i put that in client.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

here you go

if(objectID == ###) { //#### is the objectid
addItem(995,1);//995 is the coin and 1 is the amount
}
if(objectID == ####) {//#### is the objectid
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 1)) {//995 is the itemid and 1 is the amount
addItem(1041,1);//1041 is the coin and 1 is the amount
}
else {
sendMessage("you need a coin before you can get anything from this box");
}
}

there you go i think if i got my item id right its a blue phat

i put my defintions in there for you so you can understand it

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Try to be a bit clearer when asking questions. That is probably why no one has replied, because they can’t understand your problem. I am sure a member will be happy to help if you rephrase the first post to make sense.
